publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-6089 Kenneth Gibson: Time to Curb Excessive Interest Rates—That the Parliament notes with concern the sky-high interest rates being charged by short-term credit agencies, such as Wonga.com, which advertises loans of up to £1,000 on television at up to 2,689% APR of interest; believes that such companies take advantage of some of the most vulnerable people in Scotland’s society, and calls on the UK Government to act to limit maximum interest rates, as already happens in other EU countries. Supported by: Rob Gibson*, Gil Paterson*, Sandra White*, Patrick Harvie*, Bill Kidd*, Robin Harper*, Stuart McMillan*, Bob Doris*, Brian Adam*, Joe FitzPatrick*, Dave Thompson*, Aileen Campbell*
S3M-6089 Time to Curb Excessive Interest Rates (lodged on 29 March 2010) Christine Grahame*
S3M-6089 Time to Curb Excessive Interest Rates (lodged on 29 March 2010) Jamie Hepburn*
S3M-6089 Time to Curb Excessive Interest Rates (lodged on 29 March 2010) Linda Fabiani*
